title: Trump to Give Huawei More Time to Work With U.S. Customers
summary: Commerce officials to extend temporary license for the Chinese telecom currently on an export blacklist. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration is preparing to extend the length of a license that has enabled Huawei Technologies Co. to continue working with U.S. customers despite national-security concerns that landed the Chinese telecom company on an export blacklist earlier this year.

title: EU's Juncker to Undergo Emergency Gallbladder Surgery
summary: European Commission president cut short holiday. BRUSSELS-European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker has had to cut short his summer holiday and be rushed to his home nation of Luxembourg, where he is set to undergo an emergency gallbladder operation.

title: Iran-Aligned Houthis Strike Major Saudi Oil Field
summary: Shaybah oil field is attacked but crude production isn't disrupted. Yemen's Houthi rebels struck Saudi Arabia's Shaybah oil field, one of the kingdom's largest, Saudi officials and the Houthis said, deepening tensions between Iran and its rivals that have engulfed the region's energy facilities.

title: Hong Kong Protesters Soldier On for the 11th Straight Weekend
summary: Protests that dotted the city ended peacefully ahead of an antigovernment rally on Sunday. Five years ago, Hong Kong's student protesters became famous world-wide for doing their homework while camping on the streets of the city's financial district during pro-democracy protests.

title: Today's Tech IPOs Offer Lower Growth for Top Dollar
summary: Investors now pay higher prices for companies that are less profitable and growing more slowly than their predecessors. Investors who buy into today's high-profile initial public offerings are getting a raw deal. Recent tech IPOs tend to be less profitable, slower-growing and more aggressively priced than their predecessors.

title: Frugal Friends and How to Find Them
summary: Friendships can be priceless but fostering them doesn't have to come with price tag. Friendship has always called for some maintenance costs.

title: U.S. Issues Warrant to Seize Iranian Oil Tanker in Gibraltar
summary: Justice Department tries to stop Grace 1 vessel from being released. LONDON-The U.S. launched new legal action to detain an Iranian tanker in Gibraltar that has become a symbol of tensions between Tehran and the West, unveiling a warrant to seize the ship for alleged violations of American sanctions.

title: North Korea's Missile Tests Fail to Provoke Response From Washington
summary: Pyongyang sees diminished returns with its short-range launches. SEOUL-North Korea's flurry of missile launches has unfolded with a familiar pattern, coming just days apart and reaching for similar goals. The tests grab international attention, boost domestic morale and flash anger at South Korea, Japan and the U.S.

title: Fight Over For-Profit Colleges' Funding Centers on Veterans
summary: Loophole in federal-aid rule leaves GI Bill money outside the cap on schools' revenue, putting a premium on service-member recruitment.

title: China's Central Bank Reforms Rates to Boost Cheap Funding for Businesses
summary: Banks will use the Loan Prime Rate, which is based on real-world bank lending prices, to price new loans. BEIJING-China's central bank on Saturday unveiled a long-awaited reform to its interest-rate mechanism, a move aimed at reducing financing costs for businesses struggling with a cooling economy.

title: Tumblr and the End of the Eyeballs-Are-Everything Era
summary: With an adult-content problem and only the vaguest idea how to make money, Tumblr was easy prey for trends bigger than itself. At its apex, Tumblr had more users than both Instagram, now estimated to be worth close to $200 billion to parent Facebook , and Pinterest , which has a market cap of nearly $18 billion. In 2013, Tumblr sold to Yahoo for $1.1 billion. On Monday, the parent company of WordPress.com bought it for a pittance.

title: The Ice Cream Cone Renaissance
summary: Tasty new varieties are making it easy to say goodbye to cups and spoons. This time of year, I add a major food group to my diet. It's called ice cream.

title: Why Hyundai's Well-Priced Palisade Deserves to Be Labeled a Luxury SUV
summary: Dan Neil says you'd be a fool to call Hyundai's Palisade, with high-end features like a 10-inch touch screen and noise-deadening materials, anything but a luxury SUV. THIS WILL BE a two'fer. The new 2020 Hyundai Palisade SUV is mechanically quite similar to its corporate sibling, the Kia Telluride, etcetera and vice versa. However, since name-checking both would become tedious, I'll talk mostly about the former and you can assume regarding the latter.

title: PG&E Stays in Charge of Mega-Billion-Dollar Bankruptcy Exit Plan
summary: Bondholders, insurers lose bid to open up PG&E's bankruptcy to competition. PG&E Corp. scored a crucial win Friday, when the judge overseeing its massive bankruptcy allowed it to hold on to sole rights to fashion a chapter 11 exit plan.
